summary: Establishes short title as Colorado Privacy Act

key_provisions: Consumer privacy protection; Business certainty; Harmonization with other state laws

summary: Defines key terms including PersonalData SensitiveData Sale Controller Processor Consumer
key_provisions: 27 definitions including: Consent; Consumer; Controller; DeidentifiedData; PersonalData; Processing; Processor; Profiling; Sale; SensitiveData; TargetedAdvertising; ThirdParty; UniversalOptOutMechanism

summary: Defines thresholds: 100000+ consumers OR 25000+ with revenue from sale
key_provisions: 100000+ consumers threshold; 25000+ consumers + revenue threshold; Exclusions for small businesses; HIPAA GLBA FCRA exclusions

summary: Controller and processor obligations including data processing agreements
key_provisions: Controller duties: security; data minimization; purpose limitation; Processor duties: assist controller; data processing agreement requirements

summary: Establishes 5 consumer rights: Access Correct Delete Portability OptOut
key_provisions: Right to access; Right to correct; Right to delete; Right to portability; Right to opt out of: targeted advertising sale profiling; 45-day response deadline; Appeal process; AG notification if denied

summary: Exemptions and exclusions from CPA coverage
key_provisions: Processing for internal research; De-identified data processing; Certain employment contexts; Federal law compliance

summary: Opt-in consent requirement; minimization; CRITICAL: § 6-1-1308(4) secondary use prohibition
key_provisions: Opt-in consent for sensitive data; Data minimization for sensitive data; Purpose limitation for sensitive data; § 6-1-1308(4): No secondary use without new consent

summary: DPA requirements for high-risk processing; AG disclosure obligation within 30 days
key_provisions: DPA required for: targeted advertising; sale; profiling with legal effects; sensitive data processing; DPA must weigh benefits vs risks; Must disclose to AG within 30 days of request
Deletion methods; Retention exceptions; Third-party notification

summary: Attorney General enforcement authority; civil penalties; cure period sunset
key_provisions: Exclusive enforcement by AG and District Attorneys; Civil penalties up to $20000/violation; Discretionary cure period (mandatory cure period ended 2025-01-01); Injunctive relief; No private right of action

summary: Authorizes Attorney General to issue CPA Rules
key_provisions: AG authority to promulgate rules implementing CPA; CPA Rules (4 CCR 904-3) issued pursuant to this section

summary: Federal law preemption; HIPAA GLBA FCRA exclusions
key_provisions: HIPAA covered entities/business associates; GLBA institutions; FCRA consumer reporting agencies; Non-profit organizations; Higher education institutions (in certain contexts)
